Sequence Information.Source: Litoria raniformis (blue-thighed treefrog); also Litoria aurea (Green; also golden bell frog)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Leuconostoc lactis (MIC=100 μg/ml), Streptococcus uberis (MIC=50 μg/ml)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: The aurein antibiotics show more activity towards gram-positive than gram-negative pathogens. Probably acts by disturbing membrane functions with its amphipathic structure.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed by the skin dorsal glands.

Literature.Title: The antibiotic and anticancer active aurein peptides from the Australian Bell Frogs Litoria aurea and Litoria raniformis the solution structure of aurein 1.2.
Literature.Author: Rozek T, Wegener KL, Bowie JH, Olver IN, Carver JA, Wallace JC, Tyler MJ.

Literature.Title: Host-defence peptides of Australian anurans structure, mechanism of action and evolutionary significance.
Literature.Author: Apponyi MA, Pukala TL, Brinkworth CS, Maselli VM, Bowie JH, Tyler MJ, Booker GW, Wallace JC, Carver JA, Separovic F, Doyle J, Llewellyn LE.
